intro: Stylidium uniflorum subsp. extensum, commonly known as the extended triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that resemble a trigger mechanism. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, bright orange or red flowers. Stylidium uniflorum subsp. extensum is adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
